result.execSummary:
The defendant Brannon E Boatman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.
May be transferred to Milwaukee County

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brannon E Boatman

Defendant Brannon E Boatman in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brannon E Boatman in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin is looking to clean up the video quality to view it.  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brannon E Boatman in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Kati Beres, City of Brookfield,  called, sworn & testify on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  Cross examination by the defense.      Defense calls Shawn Hudson, mother of defendant; sworn & testified.    Cross examined by the State.  Court asks questions of the witness.  No further questions by the defense.  State redirects.  Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony is closed.  State moves for bind over.  Defense moves for dismissal.    Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.    Bail remains as fixed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
